channel.title: machine learning on James Brennan
channel.description: Recent content in machine learning on James Brennan

item.title: Building counterfactuals for sklearn models
item.description: Counterfactuals provide a model-agnostic method for black box machine learning algorithms interpretable and human-understandable. Counterfactuals provide explanations as to what the model would have predicted if the inputs were perturbed in a particular way. A counterfactual explanation, therefore, provides a casual description linking model inputs $X$ and predictions $Y$: “If X had not occurred, Y would not have occurred”. For example, “if I had woken up 5 minutes earlier I would have caught the train” is a counterfactual in which wakeup time $X$ is altered to change the outcome $Y=\mathrm{‘Train}$ to $Y=\mathrm{Train}$.
